eigenvectorcontinuation.continuer package#

Submodules#

eigenvectorcontinuation.continuer.eigenvector_continuer module#

Class that performs Eigenvector Continuation on any type of HSA given some type of target point

An EigenvectorContinuer object is flexible to take any valid implementation of an HSA and use it to calculate values relevant to EVC. Requires input of both training points (used in creation of the HSA), and a target point.

class eigenvectorcontinuation.continuer.eigenvector_continuer.EigenvectorContinuer(hilbert_space, target_point)#

Bases: object

Computes EVC on a given HSA and target point.

Houses the functionality to create a Hilbert Space of specified type and perform Eigenvector Continuation for a given set of training points and target points

USE CASE: 1. Create an instance of a HilbertSpaceAbstract concrete class/subclass. Requires training points (and/or other input depending on implementation) 2. Input: a target point to use and calculate the subspace hamiltonian

OUTPUT:

Eigenvalues and Eigenvectors from the Generalized Eigenvalue Problem constructed from the subspace hamiltonian and overlap matrix calculated by the training and target points

USEFUL METHODS (documentation given below):

__init__(…) calc_overlap_matrix(…) calc_sub_ham(…) solve_gep(…)

calc_overlap_matrix(input_training_points=None)#

caclulates the overlap matrix based on the Hilbert Space’s current training points

Parameters:

input_training_points – [OPTIONAL] can be used to update the hilbert space’s training points as needed

Returns:

the overlap matrix

calc_sub_ham(input_target_point=None)#

calculates the subspace hamiltonian based on the EVC’s current Hilbert Space and target point

Parameters:

input_target_point – [OPTIONAL] can be used to update the current target point of the EVC as needed

Returns:

the subspace hamiltonian

property current_target_point#

I’m this EVC’s current target point. I’m used to create the sub_ham

property evals#

I’m this EVC’s last calculated set of eigenvalues for the diagonalized subspace ham

property evecs#

I’m this EVC’s last calculated set of eigenvectors for the diagonalized subspace ham

property hilbert_space#

I’m this EVC’s hilbert space

property overlap_matrix#

I’m this EVC’s last calculated overlap matrix

refresh_overlap_matrix()#

refreshes the current overlap matrix property based on current properties

refresh_sub_ham()#

refreshes the current subspace hamiltonian based on current properties

solve_gep(input_training_points=None, input_target_point=None)#

solves the generalized eigencvalue problem for this EVC

Parameters:

  • input_training_points – used to calculate the current hilbert space’s overlap matrix. If None is passed, will default to current training_points in the hilbert space

  • input_target_point – used to calculate the current hilbert space’s subspace hamiltonian. If None is passed, will default to current_target_point in this EVC

Returns:

the evals, evecs calculated

property sub_ham#

I’m this EVC’s last calculated subspace hamiltonian
